info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 18 at 10:14AM EDT until March 18 at 9:30PM EDT by NWS Burlington VT
info.description:
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Vermont...
Otter Creek At Center Rutland affecting Rutland County.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Otter Creek at Center Rutland.
* WHEN...Until late this evening.
* IMPACTS...At 7.0 feet, There will be field flooding along Otter Creek from Clarendon downstream to Pittsford. At 8.0 feet, Low lying portions of South Creek Road will flood in Clarendon between Walker Mountain Road and Wallingford. In Pittsford, Elm Street and Depot Road will be under water. Field flooding will occur along Dorr Drive in Rutland, along with lowland flooding upstream to Wallingford and downstream to Pittsford. At 9.0 feet, In Clarendon, low lying portions of South Creek Rd. will flood between Walker Mountain Rd. and Wallingford, and water will approach Alfrecha Rd. In Pittsford, Elm St. and Depot Hill Rd. will begin to flood. Field flooding will occur along Dorr Dr. in Rutland, along with lowland flooding upstream to Wallingford and downstream to Pittsford.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:45 AM EDT Tuesday the stage was 8.6 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:45 AM EDT Tuesday was 8.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage this evening and continue falling to 5.6 feet Friday morning. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
The next statement will be this evening at 900 PM EDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS EVENING
